intro: Niphogeton chirripoi, commonly known as the Costa Rican spurge, is a flowering plant native to the humid forests of Costa Rica. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts.
